法規內容.條文內容: This set of Regulations is formulated in accordance with regulations of Paragraph 3, Article 7-1 of the Nursing Personnel Act.

Professional registered nurses who complete the nurse practitioner training in one of the specialties set forth in this set of Regulations may take part in the examination for the said nurse practitioner (hereinafter referred to as the specialty examination).

Training of the nurse practitioner shall be conducted at the hospitals accredited and announced by the central authorities. The accreditation standards are shown in Appendix 1.
The accreditation of training hospitals set forth in the preceding paragraph may be outsourced by the central authorities to private professional institutions or organizations.

Specialty examinations shall be held once every year in principle. The central authorities shall give one month's notice of relevant information about said examinations such as the date, location and registration methods prior to the examination date.
The aforementioned examinations shall be written tests, and may also consist of oral or practical tests. The passing requirement for each of the subjects in the written test, oral test, and practical test is sixty marks separately.
Only those who pass the written test may sit for the oral test or practical test; the written test results will be valid for two years before candidates pass the oral test or practical test.
The data related to specialty examinations may be destroyed after two years upon notification of the results.

法規內容.編章節: Chapter 4 Nurse Practitioner Certificate and Its Renewal

法規內容.條文內容:
The nurse practitioner certificate shall be renewed every six years.
A nurse practitioner shall, within six months before the expiration of the nurse practitioner certificate, apply to the central authorities for the said renewal by submitting proof of continuing education stipulated in Article 11 and completed within 6 years before the expiration date.
In case of failure to renew the certificate prior to the expiration due to special reasons, a written statement of reasons and supporting documents shall be submitted to the central authorities for application of postponed renewal. In the event where approval is obtained, a renewal application shall be filed within one year upon the expiration date; those who fail to renew within the time limit will have their certificates nullified.
The central authorities may commission private professional institutions or organizations to review the nurse practitioner certificate renewal applications set forth in the preceding paragraph.

Regarding the implementation methods and cumulative points of continuing education for nurse practitioners, in the case where the cumulative points obtained from nurse practitioner-related credit courses offered by a graduate institute during a semester exceed 15 points, only 15 points will be counted, except for those under Paragraph 1, Article 14 of the Regulations Governing Practice Registration and Continuing Education of Medical Personnel.
For nurse practitioners who practice nursing in areas short of medical resources, as determined by the central authorities, or those who are dispatched to foreign countries to engage in international medical services related to diplomatic purposes, their cumulative points of continuing education courses may double.
The recognition of cumulative points of continuing education courses taken by nurse practitioners may be outsourced by the central authorities to relevant professional institutions or organizations.
For those who obtained cumulative points of continuing education before the Regulations were amended and promulgated on February 25, 2011, the regulations prior to the amendment shall apply.
Once a professional registered nurse certificate is revoked or cancelled, the person's nurse practitioner certificate will also be revoked or cancelled.
This set of Regulations shall come into effect from the date of announcement.
